image.altText: A teen checks her Twitter notifications.

props.synopsis: Social media giants would be forced to ban children under the age of 14 from their platforms or face hefty penalties, under proposed laws in South Australia that could be replicated in other states.

title.children: 'Big, massive deterrent': Social media companies could face fines for allowing kids under 14 on their platforms

image.altText: A woman and a man sit at a table with documents and two photographs of soldiers.

props.synopsis: For years, 94-year-old Jack Hanna did not know where his father was buried. Now he's finally able to honour Private Richard Norman Hanna at his place of rest thanks to volunteers digging into history to give soldiers overdue recognition.

title.children: Thousands of soldiers have ended up in unmarked graves. One by one they are being found.

image.altText: Two people wearing diving suits inside water inside a cave.

props.synopsis: Inside the Three Sisters cave is a "spectacular sight" but access and safety concerns have kept divers away. Recent upgrades to the site are expected to change that.

title.children: Divers dig a new entrance to an ancient 30-metre-deep cave just metres from a rural road

image.altText: A person in a blonde mullet adjusts their wig.

props.synopsis: After growing up on a sheep station, the film was one of the first places Tom Henderson saw people who were "Queer, happy and thriving". Now, he performs as drag queen Amanda Screetly and credits the film for helping shape the culture of Broken Hill.

title.children: How the 'beautiful gift' of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert brought outback drag dreams to life

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a Willunga South property on Saturday morning but the man could not be revived.

title.children: 70yo man dies at vineyard in workplace incident in Adelaide's south

image.altText: a group of four women make cheers at a table covered in colourful drawings and textas

props.synopsis: The question of how to make friends in a regional town is often answered with joining a local sports club. But in South Australia's Riverland, a group is finding other ways to connect socially.

title.children: How do you make friends when you're new in town and don't like sport?

image.altText: Side profile of man with curly, dark hair and stubble. He wears a shirt and jacket and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney General Kyam Maher will address "gaps" in the state's law after a young mother's killer was sentenced to 11 years behind bars after he was found to be experiencing drug-induced hallucinations at the time of the offence.

title.children: SA attorney-general looks to remove self-intoxication as criminal defence

image.altText: Long green stalks of grass in plastic pots for collecting data. In the background is blue clear sky.

props.synopsis: Weeds cost Australia's crop farming industry around $3.3 billion dollars each year, but a home-grown invention that crushes herbicide-resistant weed seeds could make that a problem of the past.

title.children: Farmer invents machinery that smashes 'bejesus' out of weed seeds

image.altText: a person holding a rainbow flag

props.synopsis: Questions on both sexual orientation and gender will feature in Australia's next census, as the federal government seeks to repair the fallout from earlier efforts to abandon questions about LGBTIQ+ identity.

title.children: 'LGBTIQ+ Australians matter': Sexual orientation and gender questions to feature in next census

image.altText: A man sits on a stage with a headphone mic on

props.synopsis: South Australia's former Liberal leader David Speirs says a federal takeover of the state's branch should be 'seriously considered' but current leader Vincent Tarzia disagrees.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader suggests federal takeover of state division

image.altText: Heavy white smoke billows from the southern Lebanese Marjayoun terrain following heavy Israeli shelling

props.synopsis: An Israeli air strike has killed three Lebanese paramedics, according to the Lebanese health ministry, marking the second such attack on an emergency team in less than 12 hours.

title.children: Israeli strike kills three medics in southern Lebanon, health ministry says

image.altText: Actress Nicole Kidman with her mother Janelle Ann Kidman as they attend the 2018 AACTA Awards

props.synopsis: The Australian actress leaves the film festival after learning the news her mother had died aged 84.

title.children: Nicole Kidman reveals mother's death in Venice Film Festival acceptance speech

image.altText: Felise Kaufusi and Jarrod Wallace run to celebrate with Dolphins teammate Jamayne Isaako after a try against Newcastle.

props.synopsis: Manly have fallen short of claiming a home final after going down to Cronulla while the Dolphins and Knights are about to play off for the last spot in the top eight. Follow live.

title.children: Cronulla brush Manly aside, Dolphins and Knights fight it out for finals spot

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: Ten people died when the bus Brett Andrew Button was driving crashed on the way home from a wedding. This week he is expected to receive a jail term, but not before hearing from dozens of the victims' family and friends and those who survived the crash.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver to come face to face with devastated loved ones of those killed

image.altText: A young boy in a spiderman outfit with a grey picture in the background of people searching a bush.

props.synopsis: A decade after the boy in the Spider-Man suit vanished from his foster grandmother's home on the NSW Mid North Coast, police are no closer to finding him.

title.children: Why we may never know what happened to William Tyrrell

image.altText: King Charles and Queen Camilla pose formally in dress wear in an ornate room with gold furnishing.

props.synopsis: King Charles has been dragged into a Senate drama over an obscure push to remove references to Queen Elizabeth from Australia's laws.

title.children: A royal clean-up sparks Senate fight over King Charles

image.altText: A bright electronic billboard advertising the turquoise waters of Fiji in a neon lit streetscape in China.

props.synopsis: As Palau's president tangled with China over tourist numbers, other Pacific Island nations were looking to its giant market of travellers to fill their resorts and hotels.

title.children: 'The bad guy is the first to complain': Is China 'weaponising' tourism in the Pacific?

image.altText: A graphic shows a woman with a blurred face looking at a mobile phone with a message above her.

props.synopsis: After a university student was bombarded with doctored, sexually explicit images of herself, the abusive comments started. So did a plan to bring down the perpetrators of what one expert describes as a problem so rife in South Korea it is "national disaster".

title.children: It started with a flood of 'ominous' texts. Then Ruma saw her face on fake porn images

image.altText: Composite of Rupert Murdoch, his two daughters and two sons

props.synopsis: Lachlan Murdoch turns 53 today, his first birthday since taking over the family's media empire from his father Rupert in November. And if he finds himself in a contemplative state of mind, how might he reflect upon the great balance sheet of life?

title.children: The bitter battle tearing a family apart: Inside the Murdochs' real-life Succession drama

image.altText: A man with white hair wearing a suit gesturing with both hands open to the side as if asking why

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu has built a proud reputation of being known as Mr Security, but now there's a new moniker that's being attached to him — Mr Death.

title.children: Even with the nickname 'Mr Death', Netanyahu seems invincible. One thing could bring him down

image.altText: A man in a white coat touching a Tomahawk cruise missile

props.synopsis: An American weapons company made illegal technology transfers to Australia at the same time some of its staff members took work laptops containing sensitive military secrets into Russia and Iran.

title.children: Australian links revealed in global defence company scandal involving China, Russia and Iran

image.altText: Parked vehicles block the lanes on a highway in the late evening.

props.synopsis: The local sheriff's office has named a 32-year-old man as a person if interest in connection with the shootings, saying he should be considered armed and dangerous.

title.children: Kentucky police hunting suspect after drivers shot in traffic on interstate highway

image.altText: Old, disused farmhouse in the foreground with two giant wind turbines in the background

props.synopsis: As Australia's electricity system gets cleaner, it is encountering a strange problem. More renewable energy is having to be wasted.

title.children: Australia is 'wasting' record amounts of green energy. Here's why experts say it's a good thing

image.altText: Drone shot of Katanning

props.synopsis: When listing WA tourist hotspots, Katanning probably doesn't come to mind. But after featuring in multiple Malaysian travel videos, it has grabbed the attention of more than 1 million YouTube viewers.

title.children: Small WA town with 'more Malay culture than Malaysia' becomes YouTube hit in Asia

image.altText: Q+A/YouGov Poll: 09 September 2024

props.synopsis: Most Australians are happy for the value of their homes to fall to make housing more affordable, a new Q+A/YouGov poll finds, with voters giving their verdict on policy solutions.

title.children: Rob super, end tax breaks: Australia's verdict on fixing housing policy

image.altText: A black and white photograph of Princess Diana

props.synopsis: The Japanese photographer's sublime black-and-white photographs cleverly capture subjects as diverse as polar bears and landscapes, to historical figures.

title.children: How Hiroshi Sugimoto tricks us into believing he’s photographed everyone from Princess Di to Napoleon

image.altText: Pope Francis sits next to a microphone and holds papers

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was greeted by dancers adorned with feathers and brightly-painted faces, signing traditional hymns.

title.children: Thousands gather for 'once-in-a-lifetime' experience of holy mass with Pope Francis in PNG

image.altText: a map of new south wales with markers showing the locations of people who reported feeling an earthquake

props.synopsis: With the NSW Hunter Region in the midst of an "earthquake swarm", and mining found to have caused tremors overseas, could it be the cause here too?

title.children: Is mining causing the NSW earthquakes? Here's what a seismologist has to say

image.altText: More than a dozen young French men and women shout as they climb on top of a statue.

props.synopsis: A majority of French people now consider President Emmanuel Macron to have "stolen" the country's recent legislative election, after he chose centre-right former Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier to form a government despite a leftist coalition winning the most seats.

title.children: Thousands protest in France after Macron refuses to name leftist prime minister

image.altText: A close up of the Queen smiling in a purple coat and matching hat.

props.synopsis: Two years ago an important chapter in royal history came to a full stop with the death of Queen Elizabeth II. Everything was about to change.

title.children: The Queen was dead; long live King Charles. Then everything changed

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka holds the US Open trophy

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka was forced to dig deep in both sets of a straight-sets win over America's Jessica Pegula to win her third career grand slam title.

title.children: 'I was literally praying': Aryna Sabalenka left 'speechless' after surviving tense US Open final

image.altText: A close up image of a man wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Two new reports paint a picture of an overburdened and under-resourced mental health system, with about 75 per cent of Australians feeling elevated levels of distress compared to the same time last year.

title.children: Linda felt let down after her husband died by suicide.  Two decades later, people are still falling through the cracks

image.altText: A squat, round white space capsule sits on sandy ground at night with a light on inside it, surrounded by golden material.

props.synopsis: After months of turmoil over its safety, Boeing's new space capsule departs the International Space Station and lands in New Mexico — without its astronauts.

title.children: Boeing's troubled Starliner capsule returns to Earth empty, leaving astronauts waiting on ISS

image.altText: A lady with white shirt sits on stairs and smiles

props.synopsis: After a shock cancer diagnosis, Ros Worthington is spending her final weeks preparing her close family and friends for her end-of-life while pushing for access to voluntary assisted dying to be extended to people with dementia.

title.children: With no option left but to die, Ros is spending her last weeks with family — and pushing to expand voluntary assisted dying
